I highly recommend this top to anyone looking for a comfortable, versatile, and affordable casual wear option. Whether you're a student, an office worker, or simply a fashion enthusiast, this top is sure to a great purchase.

This is not a sweater. I hoped it might feel like a light weight sweater but it's a stretchy spandex feeling fabric. It doesn't bother me but I'm afraid it looks cheap when you see it up close.  It's loose and comfortable. I'm 5'7, 170, 38D and got a large. I definitely could have sized down but didn't want it too form fitting. The sleeves are long, which is nice. It's kind of thin, but thats ok since it doesn't get super cold in Texas. If it was a size smaller you would definitely see the outline of my bra.  I'm not sure whether I'll keep it yet. I keep trying it on. It's been out of the package for a few weeks and the crease from folding it still hasn't gone away. I even tossed it in the dryer after spritzing water on the crease. It's straight across the chest between the bust and neck. Glaringly obvious. I would hope it would come out after washing but don't want to try that until I decide if I want to keep it for sure.

The material is slightly scratchy and not as heavy as it appears. You can tell it’s synthetic. I missed the window to return so I bit the bullet and tried it on with a turtleneck underneath and actually like it better. Wore it once so not sure how it’ll hold up in the wash. I will hang to dry just in case. Sleeves are long, but that’s my norm. It’s warm with another layer underneath and kinda cute. Hope that helps you decide!

But also, this is such a nice, comfortable and versatile top. Easily paired with jeans or dress pants so you can wear this while out running errands or to the office. You'll look great doing either!  The sleeves are a little long, but I don't mind that at all, as few things bother me as much as sleeves that are too short! I am 5'4", 125 lbs and I'm very happy with the fit of the small.
